intro: Saccus, commonly known as the bladderwort, is a genus of aquatic plants belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. These plants are characterized by their unique bladder-like structures, which are used to trap small aquatic organisms. The saccus is typically found in freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes. The plant's morphology includes submerged stems and specialized bladders that aid in nutrient acquisition. Saccus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to the food web and maintaining water quality.
